data.text:
Book #14620

Town and Country Lovers

Nadine Gordimer

Binding: Cloth

Book Condition: Fine+ in Fine+ dust jacket

Edition: Limited/Numbered Edition

Publisher: Los Angeles: Sylvester & Orphanos, 1980.

Town and Country Lovers

Nadine Gordimer

A most handsome Limited Numbered first edition in Very Fine condition in alike acetate dust-jacket, SIGNED and numbered by author and Nobel Laureate Nadine Gordimer directly on the Limitations page. Bound in black and tan patterned cloth, this copy is number 60 of 300 numbered copies (330 copies total in this Limited edition: 26 are lettered and 4 bear the printed name of a recipient. ).

Published in Gordimer's short story collection, A Soldier's Embrace, 'Town and Country Lovers' depicts the strained race relations in South Africa by showing the devastating consequences of violating the legal and societal rules about interracial relationships; Large 8vo; Signed by Author.

Price: $140.00

Award Winner

The Books Tell You Why Guarantee

Consistent with, and exceeding the policies and Code of Ethics of the Antiquarian Booksellers' Association of America (ABAA) and the Universal Autograph Collectors Club (UACC), Books Tell You Why guarantees the authenticity of autographed items for the lifetime of the original purchaser, i.e., Books Tell You Why will provide a full refund of the original purchasing price incl. two-way shipping at any time where lack of authenticity can be proven and where proof of purchase is supplied by the original purchaser.
